Ad Text:
Mining Technical and Financial Advisory | Client-Facing Consulting Role
Own the analysis. Stand behind the numbers. Advise the decision.
Xenith is a leading consulting firm supporting the Resources, Energy and Infrastructure sectors across the full asset lifecycle. Our Advisory team works at the intersection of technical, financial and strategic decision-making — supporting corporates, investors and financiers on critical transactions and investments.
We are seeking a Principal Analyst – Advisory to strengthen our senior analytical capability and provide trusted, defensible advice to clients across the resources sector.
This is a senior, hands-on role for a highly analytical professional who is comfortable owning complex financial and technical analysis, engaging directly with clients, and contributing to high-value investment and transaction decisions.
The Opportunity
Based in Brisbane, this role is suited to an experienced mining, investment or financial advisory professional operating at Principal / Senior Consultant level.
You will work across a diverse portfolio of projects supporting mining companies, financial institutions, private equity, legal and accounting firms.
You will:
• Lead and deliver high-quality analytical work across advisory engagements
• Act as a trusted advisor to clients at technical, commercial and executive level
• Take ownership of complex models, assumptions and conclusions
• Provide senior input into transactions, valuations and investment decisions
• Mentor junior analysts and lift analytical standards across the team
This is not a coordination or reporting-only role. You will remain close to the analysis, the detail and the decisions.
Key Responsibilities
Analytical Leadership & Advisory Delivery
• Lead and review complex financial, technical and commercial analysis
• Develop and interrogate financial models for mining and resource assets
• Apply strong judgement to assumptions, sensitivities and scenarios
• Ensure analytical outputs are robust, defensible and decision-ready
Transaction & Investment Support
• Support M&A transactions and investment decisions
• Deliver technical due diligence and expert assessments
• Contribute to mineral asset valuations and investment evaluations
• Support lenders, investors and boards with clear, evidence-based advice
Client Advisory & Communication
• Act as a client-facing advisor, presenting findings clearly and confidently
• Translate complex technical and financial analysis into clear insights
• Prepare high-quality reports, expert opinions and advisory papers
• Support expert witness work and independent advisory engagements
Mentoring & Capability Building
• Mentor analysts and consultants across the Advisory team
• Lift analytical rigour, modelling standards and commercial thinking
• Contribute to internal methodologies, templates and best practice
About You
You are an analytical, commercially astute professional who thrives in complex problem-solving environments.
You have experience as a professional analyst in or serving the mining and resources industry, preferably underpinned by demonstrable experience in a technical discipline.
You are comfortable standing behind your work and explaining it to sophisticated stakeholders.
You thrive in a client serving, demanding and dynamic consulting environment.
Skills, Qualifications & Experience
• Degree in Mining Engineering, Finance, Economics, Geology or related discipline
• Typically 8–15+ years’ experience in mining, investment, financial or technical advisory
• Exceptional analytical skills with strong attention to detail
• Advanced financial modelling and analytical capability
• Experience across mining projects, transactions or resource investments
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Comfortable working in a client-facing consulting environment
• Commercially aware, pragmatic and outcome-focused
Why Xenith
• High-trust, technically strong consulting culture
• Exposure to complex, high-impact advisory work
• Flexible working arrangements
• Competitive remuneration aligned to seniority and accountability

Shape how a member-owned bank uses data and AI to do the right thing at scale
Highly reputable and trusted brand and Employer of Choice for Gender Equality
Competitive salary package on offer to attract the very best 

We are now seeking a Head of Data & AI to lead strategy, governance and delivery, turning data into trusted insights and responsible AI into real business and member outcomes.

About the role

Reporting to the Chief Digital Officer, this role is about building foundations that last, not running one-off programs. You will shape how data and AI are prioritised, governed and delivered across the bank, working closely with Technology, Digital, Transformation, Business leaders and the Executive Data & AI Committee.

You’ll balance ambition with pragmatism, delivering value incrementally while embedding strong risk, privacy and ethical guardrails in line with APRA and Australian regulatory expectations.

A clear, enterprise-wide data and AI strategy aligned to IMB’s business priorities and member outcomes
Prioritisation of high-value use cases across customer insights, risk, operations and decision-making
Embedded governance across the full lifecycle  from idea to production to retirement
Sustainable in-house capability, supported by partners where appropriate
A multidisciplinary team of data engineers, analysts, scientists and architects
A modern data and analytics ecosystem across AWS, Microsoft (including Power BI/Azure) and IBM DataStage

What you’ll bring

Senior leadership experience building data, analytics and AI capabilities within financial services or regulated environments
Strong technical grounding across cloud platforms, data engineering, analytics and machine learning
Deep understanding of data risk, privacy and AI governance, with the confidence to advise executives on trade-offs and investment decisions
A collaborative, pragmatic leadership style — able to influence, simplify and deliver
A commitment to ethical, responsible and transparent use of data and AI

Why IMB?

IMB Bank is a leading customer-owned bank offering a full range of products and services in both retail and business banking. Our purpose is to provide simple, competitive, and authentic banking to help our customers and communities be better off and we’ve doing that for over 145 years. An award-winning and growing organisation, we’ve donated more than $13 million through our Community Foundation to over 1100 projects in our communities.   

IMB benefits include:

Great training and onboarding 
Genuine career pathways and opportunity to accelerate your skills and experience
A supportive culture that actively promotes diversity and inclusion and the wellbeing of our employees 
Designated wellbeing days
Friendly and professional team environment
Product concessions
Purchased leave options

Apply now by visiting imbcareers.com.au and follow the prompts. Application close date 27th February 2026.

Company description:



At EY, we're all in to shape your future with confidence. We'll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go. Join EY and help to build a better working world.



Job description:



The opportunity

EY Parthenon's Canberra Infrastructure Advisory (IA) team is a high‑impact, trusted advisor to government, working on complex policy, economic and strategic challenges that shape Australia's long‑term direction. As a Manager, you will lead multidisciplinary teams to support government clients across strategy, policy reform, investment and major transactions, helping them navigate high‑stakes choices that shape long‑term outcomes for communities, sectors and the nation.

With a strong market presence across international engagement and development, transport, energy and utilities, sustainability and defence, the IA Canberra practice plays a unique role in advancing Australia's engagement across the Asia‑Pacific, supporting infrastructure programs that strengthen regional connectivity and contribute to long‑term growth and resilience. This gives the team's work both national and international significance.

As a Manager, you will help tackle complex policy, economic and strategic issues, lead analytical work, translate insights into clear and actionable recommendations, oversee project delivery, and contribute to scaling the team's capability and market presence. The role offers substantial leadership responsibility alongside opportunities for deep professional development through EY's global network.

Your key responsibilities

Manage client engagements, including scoping, delivery and governance.
Build strong relationships across EY, and with clients and industry partners.
Provide evidence‑based commercial, economic and strategic policy advice to government clients.
Produce high‑quality, accessible reports and presentations.
Build and apply analytical models, including cost-benefit analysis and impact assessments.
Mentor and develop junior team members, building IA Canberra's overall capability.
Support business development, including high‑quality proposal preparation.
Continue to grow your strengths, sector expertise and professional offering.

Skills and attributes for success

5-10 years' experience in a similar government or private‑sector role.
Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline, for example finance, accounting, engineering, economics, law, business administration or international relations.
Strong analytical, problem‑solving and communication skills across quantitative and qualitative domains.
Experience working with datasets and building or interpreting economic/financial models.
Ability to translate complex analysis into actionable insights for non‑technical audiences.
Experience advising government on strategic policy issues, or a strong interest in developing this expertise.
Excellent interpersonal and client‑management skills, with confidence engaging internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to lead and manage multiple projects and people, balancing competing priorities.
A proactive, positive and collaborative mindset aligned with IA Canberra culture.
Willingness to travel to support domestic and international government partners.
Australian citizenship, required for Federal Government security clearances.

Acknowledgement of Country

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.
